name: The Kings Arms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After being bitterly disappointed with the hotel we originally planned on staying in for 3 nights, we only stayed 1 night and were left looking for somewhere for the 2nd and 3rd nights of our break. Fortunately we were recommended to try this hotel.
reviews.title: We enjoyed a wonderful stay!
Pretentious
reviews.text: Immediately we walked in we received a warm welcome from the reception staff, who went out of their way to find us a suitable room. The accommodation was lovely; spotlessly clean, luxurious, and very reasonably priced. The breakfast is served in the room, and whilst described as a continental breakfast, it was more than lavish. Toast, (still hot, which is quite unusual), croissants, danish pastries, pain au chocolat, fresh fruit, orange juice, tea and coffee were all on the tray, along with a selection of butter and preserves.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't be put off by the apparent lack of parking. There is a secure car park at the back of the hotel, acessed through locked gates.
reviews.title: Noisy Noisy Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a single night stay with a three course dinner in the Gary Rhodes Brassiere for a total price of £115. On arrival, we were informed that we had been upgraded to a platinum room at no additional cost. On entering the room, we were amazed at the quality and luxury. Yes, it was at the front of the building and a little noisy, but with the windows closed this is not such a problem. The full length shuttered sash windows are a beautiful feature and should not be replaced with double glazing, although perhaps a well installed secondary glazing unit would resolve the noise issue. As others have commented, it was quite warm in the room (the sun had been out all day) but it cooled down at night. Perhaps the owners should consider air conditioning to resolve the heat complaints, but for us it was not an issue. The bar and restaurant were superb, prices very reasonable and the service just right. A lovely continental breakfast was delivered to our room at the requested time. We understand that Gary Rhodes himself had visited at lunchtime. so he is clearly keeping his eye on standards.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, our stay was wonderful and the staff very efficient.
reviews.title: No Parking. Hot Rooms. Good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed in The Kings Arms Hotel over August bank holiday weekend. We needed to be in Christchurch for a family event and thought this would be a perfect base.
reviews.title: Like being in an tiny oven

reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located in Christchurch - not far from the church, boat hire, shops and local transport.
reviews.title: HOT and noisy...what a shame.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is on a busy main road and there is absolutely NO PARKING. Well there is a small space opposite the hotel which they class as their 'car park' - in actual fact it can barely fit 6 cars and there was NEVER a space for us.
reviews.title: Rooms are like a sauna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had sunday lunch here, nice roast beef small dish of veg 1 floret of cauliflower 6 rounds of carrot and the dregs of the pan of parsnips, asked for more parsnips just got told had a run on the roast and didn't offer me anything else, very more srevice staff don't do smiles they have no idea how to serve the customers. Not like it was when Gary Rhodes put in name too the place.
reviews.title: very poor veg

reviews.text: I stayed here with my boyfriend and another friend, we had 2 rooms in this hotel. We were in the area for a friends wedding in Bournemouth. The hotel is stylish and very clean. We had to wait a little while in reception as another couple were checking in.
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel – clean rooms – problems parking though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a very small lift that fits, 1 person plus a large suitcase or 2/3 people.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was lovely, bit of a strange shape though as it has to accommodate itself to the building. Bathroom was again an odd shape but clean and well looked after.
reviews.title: Long live the Kings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had issues parking when we got there, so were advised to park on the road a little further down from the hotel. We managed to find a space and got a parking ticket the following day, not realising it was a timed space.
reviews.title: Shame about the noise but don't let it put you off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel staff friendly, stayed in platinum room overlooking priory and green. although would ask for room to back next time as road directly below, and in summer would think alittle noisy. comfortable and clean, great location we ate at connquerer and had lunch at rhodes south. The breakfast was disappointing had to ask for freshly cooked bacon not dried up as was plated. will definately visit again soon. taxi from station was £3.20.
reviews.title: great friendly hotel
King of the Castle!
reviews.text: The Kings Hotel has beautiful views over the Christchurch Castle Ruins and the lovely quintessentially English, Kings Arms Bowling Greens. From the minute you step inside The Kings, it envelopes you in a welcoming warmth and comfortable glow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to find somewhere different for a dinner out with friends and as we are fairly local, decided to visit The Kings. We loved the chic, contemporary but very stylish bar with its warm and professional service… we were even offered a variety of Rosé wines to try before making out choice which was a treat. The bar also offers a very nice selection of lighter dishes and nibbles… nice if you just want to pop in for a social drink with friends.
reviews.title: A fabulous hotel offering luxurious surroundings, excellent service and exceptionally fine food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant décor is classical contemporary offering modern English dishes and very well presented. The menu changes regularly and is quite varied offering modern English choices, very well presented. The wine list is comprehensive but not overpriced. There is no feeling of pretension and the staff are very friendly and communicative.
reviews.title: Gem of a Town Centre Hotel!

reviews.text: Although we never stayed overnight and can't comment about the rooms, we are now regulars for the restaurant and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Best Chocolate Fondant ever

description: The Kings Arms in Christchurch, is a stunning Georgian building in the heart of Dorset - combining a traditional yet stylish Restaurant with luxurious bedrooms carefully restored in true Georgian style, whilst Alex Aitken remains chef patron at The Jetty he is also spending time with the chefs and team at The Kings Arms, Alex has headed up the team re-styling the restaurant menus and cooking philosophy. The Kings Restaurant has a delicious menu using the best local ingredients.The Kings Arms has everything you need for a Dorset short break, situated in the historic town of Christchurch, Dorset, a popular yachting town, overlooking the Avon River, Christchurch Castle and The Kings Arms Bowling Green, The Kings is marvelously picturesque. A short distance from the Dorset Jurassic Coast, The Kings Arms combines coastal beauty, historical town discoveries and stunning scenery, all with a comfortable place to relax after a day's adventures.
